name: Hugo
description: Hugo is one of the most popular open-source static site generators. With its amazing speed and flexibility, Hugo makes building websites fun again.

name: Jekyll
description: Jekyll is a simple, blog-aware, static site generator for personal, project, or organization sites. Written in Ruby by Tom Preston-Werner, GitHub’s co-founder, it is distributed under the open source MIT license.

name: Gatsby
description: Gatsby is a free and open source framework based on React that helps developers build blazing fast websites and apps

name: 11ty
description: 11ty is a simpler static site generator. It's easy to use, flexible, and doesn’t require a lot of configuration.

name: Next
description: Next.js is a React framework for production, it enables React based web applications experiences by providing a set of features that are needed in production such as SSR, SSG, and many more.

name: Nuxt
description: Nuxt.js is a free and open source web application framework based on Vue.js, Node, Webpack and Babel.js.

name: Docusaurus
description: Docusaurus is a modern static website generator. It was created to help you generate, maintain, and deploy documentation websites.

name: Sphinx
description: Sphinx is a tool that makes it easy to create intelligent and beautiful documentation, written by Georg Brandl and licensed under the BSD license.

name: Hakyll
description: Hakyll is a Haskell library for creating static websites. It is inspired by Jekyll, but is not a port of it.

name: Cobalt
description: Cobalt is a static site generator written in Rust. It is inspired by Jekyll and Hexo.

name: Jungle
description: Jungle is a static site generator written in JavaScript. It is inspired by Jekyll and Hexo.
